result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:50 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Lindsay Amber Schmidt, Defendant Lindsay Amber Schmidt in court, in custody. INCLUDES 21CM646, 22CM17, 22CM382 and 22CF16. ADA Smestad recites agreement. DE sworn. 22CF16 (WOPH): Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. PLEAS: DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Retail Theft in 22CF16. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Information forthcoming. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Retail Theft in 22CF16. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses and reads in 22CM17 for purposes of restitution and cases 21CM646 and 22CM382 outright. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. QUASH WARRANTS. Atty. Davis states DE is unable to pay attorney fees. Atty. Davis waives attorney fees from Order signed 4/19/22. 

Court orders: 
22CF16
S/W 2 years probation with conditions - consecutive to E/S in Dunn County case 19CF138

- Restitution $668.37, payable to Beth's Jewelry Shop in New Richmond, WI; payable through DOC
- Restitution $292.21, payable to Carquest Auto Parts in River Falls, WI; payable through DOC
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

records.addlTxt:
Includes 22CF16 and 22CM17.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Best Jewelry Shop, E.U., or Car Quest Auto Parts.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Settlement conference on January 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on February 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Includes 22CF16 INIT, 22CM17 INIT, 21CM646 RW- SJN. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Court questions non-appearance in 21CM646. DE states she had a severe concussion and was notified yesterday that she had a warrant. Court reinstates bond and QUASHES WARRANT in 21CM646. Court enters NG pleas and reserves on pre-plea rights in 22CM17. Court judicially transfers 22CM17 and 22CF16 to Branch 1. Adjourned at 1:53 PM.  gll  Settlement conference scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
